comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: A search on Friedrichshafen did not produce this one because of a small typo in the admittedly difficult name. idFlieg identifications were also with Roman numerals, G.II. A rare picture showing a machine seemingly fitted with night flying equipment, four lamps in the nose and several at the underside of the fuselage. For the G.III Friedrichshafen took the precaution to fit an anti-noseover wheel, probably learning from the experience of the G.II.
